text: Idaea costaria is a species of moth of the family Geometridae. It is found in south-eastern Australia. Idaea costaria is externally very similar to Idaea inversata but, unlike that species, has a two-coloured head pattern. Idaea costaria has a creamy-white patch between the antennae, whereas I. inversata is dark reddish throughout this area. ==References== Category:Sterrhini Category:Moths of Australia Category:Moths described in 1857
title: Idaea costaria
